bill_title: distribute a portion of the tobacco and alcohol taxes to a fund for the purpose of funding medicaid.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to distribute a portion of the tobacco and alcohol taxes to a fund for the purpose of funding medicaid. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-50-52 be amended to read as follows: 10-50-52. The money received by the secretary of revenue shall deposit sixty percent of the revenue from the tax imposed by this chapter shall be credited by him to the state general fund and forty percent of the revenue to medicaid fund . Section 2. That chapter 35-5 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The commissioner of the Bureau of Finance and Management shall transfer thirty percent of the revenue deposited in the alcoholic beverage fund to the medicaid fund. Section 3. The medicaid fund is hereby created in the state treasury. The commissioner of Bureau of Finance and Management may transfer moneys available from the fund to the general fund as necessary to provide for the state's participation in the medicaid program. The moneys deposited in the fund shall be invested by the state investment council pursuant to chapter 4-5 and all interest and profits derived from such investment shall be retained in the fund. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
